string-array.name: atlantic_descriptions
string-array.item: Wide and triangular. A full knot best suited for spread collar shirts.
Bring the wide end of the tie under the narrow.
Bring the narrow end up through the middle.
Then back down to the left.
Bring the narrow end behind the wide end and then up.
Bring the narrow end through the middle.
And push the narrow end down through the loop in back.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: diagonal_descriptions
string-array.item: The asymmetric nature of this knot gives it an elegantly casual presence.
Place the tie around your neck. The wide end of the tie should be on your left side and should be longer than the narrow end by a few inches.
Bring the wide end of the tie over the narrow.
Bring the wide end back around the narrow end.
Then loop it around again.
Bring the wide end up and through the middle to the right.
Pass the wide end through the loop in front.
Pull the ends gently to tighten the knot.
Follow the picture.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: four_in_hand_descriptions
string-array.item: Narrow and slightly asymmetrical. The perfect knot of a standard button-down dress shirt.
Place the tie around your neck. The wide end of the tie should be on your left side and should be longer than the narrow end by a few inches.
Bring the wide end of the tie over the narrow.
Swing the wide end behind the narrow end to the left.
Swing it over in front.
Then up through the back.
Hold the front of the knot loose with your index finger, pass the wide end down through the loop in front.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: half_windsor_descriptions
string-array.item: Symmetrical and triangular. A knot you can use with any dress shirt.
Place the tie around your neck. The wide end of the tie should be on your left side and it should be longer than the narrow end by a few inches.
Bring the wide end of the tie over the narrow end.
Swing the wide end behind the narrow end to the left.
Bring the wide end up and down through the middle.
Swing it around to the front.
Bring the wide end up through the back.
Hold the front of the knot loose with your index finger, pass the wide end down through the loop in front.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: kelvin_descriptions
string-array.item: Narrow and slightly asymmetrical. Small but flashy tie knot for any occasion.
The tie knot should begin inside-out.
Bring the wide end of the tie under the narrow end.
Swing the wide end across the front to the left.
Bring the wide end around the back toward the right.
Swing it around to the left.
Bring the wide end up through the back.
Hold the front of the knot loose with your finger, pass the wide end down through the loop in front.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: oriental_descriptions
string-array.item: A simple small casual look.
The tie should begin inside-out.
Bring the wide end of the tie under the narrow end.
Swing the wide end across the front, from right to left.
Bring the wide end up through the back.
Hold the front of the knot loose with your index finger, pass the wide end down through the loop in front.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: persian_descriptions
string-array.item: Ideal for thin neckties and spread collar shirts.
Place the tie around your neck. The wide end of the tie should be on your left side and should be longer than the narrow end by a few inches.
Bring the wide end of the tie over the narrow.
Bring the wide end up and through the inside of the loop around your neck.
Then down.
Bring the wide end around the back of the narrow end, from right to left.
Bring the wide end up, then down through the middle to the right.
Swing it around to the front of the tie.
Go up through the middle from the back.
Bring the wide end down and through the loop.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: plattsburg_descriptions
string-array.item: Great with spread collar shirts. Symmetrical and wide.
The knot should begin inside-out.
Bring the wide end of the tie under the narrow.
Swing the wide end up.
Turn the wide end down through the middle, to the left.
Bring the wide end of the tie up.
Then down through the middle, to the right.
Swing it over in front to the left.
Then up through the back.
Hold the front of the knot loose with your index finger, pass the wide end down through the loop in front.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: pratt_descriptions
string-array.item: A good dimple is made before you tighten the knot at your necktie.
The tie knot should begin inside-out.
Bring the wide end of the tie under the narrow.
Swing the wide end up and down through the middle.
Swing it over in front.
Then up through the back.
Hold the front of the knot loose with your index finger, pass the wide end down through the loop in front.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: simple_double_descriptions
string-array.item: Best suited for classic collar dress shirts.
Place the tie around your neck. The wide end of the tie should be on your left side and should be longer than the narrow end by a few inches.
Bring the wide end of the tie over the narrow.
Swing the wide end behind the narrow.
Bring the wide end in front of the narrow end.
Then behind
and in front of the narrow end again.
Bring the wide end up through the middle from the back.
Hold the front of the knot loose with your finger, pass the wide end down through the loop in front.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: st_andrew_descriptions
string-array.item: The knot has a depth which allows it to stand up and drape well.
The tie knot should begin inside-out.
Bring the wide end of the tie under the narrow.
Swing the wide end in front and to the left.
Bring the wide end behind the narrow end.
Bring the wide end of the tie up and then down through the middle to the left.
Swing it over in front, to the right.
Then up through the back.
Hold the front of the knot loose with your index finger, pass the wide end down through the loop in front.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: windsor_descriptions
string-array.item: Thick and wide with a triangular shape, the Windsor knot is best suited for spread collar shirts.
Place the tie around your neck. The wide end of the tie should be on your left side and should be longer than the narrow end by a few inches.
Bring the wide end of the tie over the narrow.
Bring the wide end up through the middle.
Bring the wide end over to the left.
Bring the wide end behind the narrow end.
Bring the wide end of the tie up.
Bring the wide end down through the middle, to the left.
Swing it over in front, to the right.
Then bring it up through the back.
Hold the front of the knot loose with your index finger, pass the wide end down through the loop in front.
Tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!

string-array.name: bowtie_descriptions
string-array.item: Most classic for all ties and commonly worn during black tie events. One should choose the bow tie when wearing a tuxedo.
Place the bow tie around your neck. One end of the bow tie should be longer than the other by a few inches.
Cross the long end over the short one.
Bring the long end up through the middle.
Form the front loop of the bow tie by folding the short end horizontally.
This loop will be the front loop of the completed tie.
Drop the long end of the tie over the front of the bow.
Holding tightly the front loop you made, form a new loop with the long end by doubling the end over itself.
Push this loop through the front loop behind the bow tie.
Pull both ends gently to tighten the knot.
Check your tie knot with a picture!
